propertyGroup.name: Outlets
propertyGroup.documentation: Defines the locations to which output is generated.

property.name: services
property.documentation: The location to which all service classes (including the service locator(s)) will be generated.

property.name: service-impls
property.documentation: The location to which all service implementation classes will be generated.

property.name: daos
property.documentation:
The location to which Spring DAOs, and any support classes.
Please NOTE that the dao implementation classes will also be generated to this location when no operations are present on the entity with classifier scope.

property.name: dao-impls
property.documentation:
The location to which Spring DAO implementation classes will be generated (if there are any classifier scoped business operations modeled on any entity).
Please NOTE that the dao implementation classes will be generated to the daos outlet when no operations are present on the entity with classifier scope.

property.name: spring-configuration
property.documentation: The location to which the Spring applicationContext.xml will be generated.

property.name: open-session-in-view
property.documentation: The location to which the AndroMDA OpenSessionInViewFilter will be generated (allows the Hibernate open-session-in-view pattern when you want to expose your enties directly to your presentation tier - allows lazy-loading to occur that level).

property.name: session-ejbs
property.documentation: Not really used from the template except to check if it has been defined or not, so that we can determine whether or not we'll use the session EJBs for transaction management (rather than Spring's transaction framework)

property.name: advice-impls
property.documentation: The location to which any advice implementation classes will be generated. Currently this is useful when using the cartridge's remoting support.

property.name: daoNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the DAO name. {0} is used to represent the entity name in the model, so if you specified a value of {0}Dao all the entities generated would have a suffix of "Dao".

property.name: daoBaseNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the base DAO's name. {0} is used to represent the entity name in the model, so if you specified a value of {0}DaoBase all the entities generated would have a suffix of "DaoBase".

property.name: daoImplementationNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the DAO's implementation name. {0} is used to represent the entity name in the model, so if you specified a value of {0}DaoImpl all the entities generated would have a suffix of "DaoImpl".

property.name: ejbJndiNamePrefix
property.documentation: The prefix to give to the Session EJB JNDI names (this allows the same Session EJB to be deployed multiple times in the same container)

property.name: ejbPackageNamePattern
property.documentation: If EJBs are being used, this specifies the pattern to be used when constructing the EJB package name (this allows a Spring Service to be wrapped by a Session EJB and avoids name conflicts). The {0} character represents the service package name. This could be something like {0}.ejb which would create the Spring Session EJBs in the package ending in the ejb package.

property.name: defaultServiceExceptionNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the default service exception name. NOTE: This propety is only applicable when defaultServiceExceptions is true.

property.name: defaultServiceExceptions
property.documentation: Whether or not to generate a default exception for each service. This exception will handle unexpected exceptions occuring within the implemented operations.

property.name: serviceRemotingType
property.documentation:
Determines the type of remoting to be used for Spring services. Can any one of
none
rmi
httpinvoker
burlap
hessian

property.name: serviceRemotePort
property.documentation: The port the exported services get published on.

property.name: serviceRemoteContext
property.documentation: The context the exported services get published on.

property.name: serviceRemoteServer
property.documentation: The remote server the Spring services get published on.

property.name: entityNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing an entity name. {0} is used to represent the entity name in the model, so if you specified a value of {0}Entity all the entities generated would have a suffix of "Entity".

property.name: serviceOperationTransactionType
property.documentation: The default transaction type used for service operations (when not wrapping your services with EJBs). NOTE: Can be overridden on a per entity basis with the @andromda.spring.transaction.type tagged value.

property.name: ejbServiceOperationTransactionType
property.documentation:
The default transaction type definition used if EJB service operations.
Permitted values are:
NotSupported
Supports
Required
RequiresNew
Mandatory
Never

property.name: ejbViewType
property.documentation: If EJBs are being used, this specifies the view type for the EJB interfaces. Can be either local or remote.

property.name: implementationOperationNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern used to the create the implementation operation name (i.e. the operations that actually perform the handling of the logic), where {0} represents the operation name

property.name: driver
property.documentation: JDBC Driver to make a database connection.

property.name: username
property.documentation: The database user login name.

property.name: password
property.documentation: The database user password.

property.name: connectionUrl
property.documentation: URL for the JDBC Driver to make the connection to the database.

property.name: dataSource
property.documentation: JNDI name of data source to use. (would be used instead of the connection properties, driver, username, password, etc).

property.name: applicationContext
property.documentation: The name given to the Spring application context file.

property.name: applicationContextManageable
property.documentation: The name given to the Spring CRUD application context file.

property.name: applicationContextDataSource
property.documentation: The name given to the Spring datasource application context file

property.name: applicationContextLocalDataSource
property.documentation: The name given to the Spring local datasource application context file

property.name: applicationContextServer
property.documentation: The name given to the Spring remote services application context xml file (server side)

property.name: applicationContextClient
property.documentation: The name given to the Spring remote services application context xml file (client side)

property.name: applicationContextRemoteEjb
property.documentation: The name/path of the application context resource file that contains the bean proxy definitions for accessing the ejb service wrappers (if generated with ejbViewType=remote) via remote ejb interfaces (i.e. some/path/applicationContext-remoteejb.xml).

property.name: applicationContextLocalEjb
property.documentation: The name/path of the application context resource file that contains the bean proxy definitions for accessing the ejb service wrappers (if generated with ejbViewType=local) via local ejb interfaces (i.e. some/path/applicationContext-localejb.xml)

property.name: beanRefFactory
property.documentation: The name/path of the bean ref factory resource file (i.e. some/path/beanRefFactory.xml)

property.name: beanRefFactoryId
property.documentation: The ID for the Spring bean reference factory (used to load the bean factory).

property.name: transactionManager
property.documentation: The transaction manager implementation used by Spring.

property.name: localTransactionManager
property.documentation: The transaction manager implementation used by Spring for the local datasource (applicationContextLocalDataSource).

property.name: userTransactionName
property.documentation: The (JNDI-) transaction manager of the J2EE container if using JTA transactions (via spring).

property.name: sessionFactory
property.documentation: Factory bean that creates a local Hibernate SessionFactory instance within Spring.

property.name: springTypesPackage
property.documentation: The package to which extra types are generated (i.e. ServiceLocator).

property.name: springPresentationTypesPackage
property.documentation: The package to which extra presentation types are generated (i.e. OpenSessionInViewFilter).

property.name: serviceLocatorName
property.documentation: The name to give the service locator class.

property.name: manageableServiceLocatorName
property.documentation: The name to give the CRUD service locator class.

property.name: clientServiceLocatorName
property.documentation: The name to give the client service locator class.

property.name: clientServiceLocatorClassloaderSwitching
property.documentation: Whether the client service locator should switch the thread context class loader during retrieval of the client application context xml file.

property.name: clientExceptionHandlingAdviceName
property.documentation: The name for the client side exception handling advice

property.name: criteriaSearchBaseName
property.documentation: The base name for the hibernate criteria search utility classes.

property.name: principalStoreName
property.documentation: The name of the principal store class.

property.name: openSessionInViewFilterName
property.documentation: The name of the OpenSessionInViewFilter (when using the open-session-in-view pattern).

property.name: springRemotingType
property.documentation: The kind of remoting to use for a spring service

property.name: securityRealm
property.documentation: The name of the security realm (i.e. animal-quiz, other, etc). NOTE:This enables EJB security if specified.

property.name: jndiDataSourceClass
property.documentation: The name of the class to use when using a JNDI data source for data access.

property.name: jdbcDataSourceClass
property.documentation: The name of the class to use when using a JDBC data source for data access.

property.name: jdbcDataSourceDestroyMethod
property.documentation: The name of the method to use for destroying the JDBC datasource.

property.name: parameterRequiredCheck
property.documentation: Whether or not parameters should be checked if they're required (on DAOs and services)

property.name: xmlEncoding
property.documentation: The encoding for xml documents

propertyGroup.name: Hibernate
propertyGroup.documentation: The properties for configuring Hibernate support generation.

property.name: hibernateVersion
property.documentation:
The version of Hibernate to use when generating.
Allowable values are:
2
3

property.name: hibernateQueryUseNamedParameters
property.documentation: Whether or not named parameters (i.e. ':someParameter') or unnamed (i.e. '?') parameters should be used in the HQL queries embedded within the model. NOTE: Does not apply to queries written in OCL.

property.name: hibernateInheritanceStrategy
property.documentation:
Defines the hibernate inheritance strategy (unless overridden on an entity level by the @andromda.hibernate.inheritance tagged value, can be the following possible values:
class - table per hierarchy.
subclass - table per class in hierarchy.
concrete - Table per class.
interface - Root class is defined as an interface and the attributes remapped to the subclasses. This is useful in the concrete case because it has limitations in the associations.

property.name: serviceHibernateInterceptorEnabled
property.documentation: Whether or not the hibernate interceptor should be enabled on services.

property.name: hibernatePoolSize
property.documentation: Hibernate connection pool size.

property.name: hibernateTransactionManagerStrategy
property.documentation: Strategy for obtaining the JTA TransactionManager

property.name: hibernateUserTransactionName
property.documentation: The JNDI name of the JTA UserTransaction object

property.name: hibernateTransactionManagerLookup
property.documentation: The fully qualified class name of the Hibernate TransactionFactory implementation

property.name: hibernateUseOuterJoin
property.documentation: Whether or not to use outer joins.

property.name: hibernateShowSql
property.documentation: Whether or not to log SQL statements (true/false). By default this is off (within Hibernate).

property.name: hibernateJndiName
property.documentation: JNDI name bound to the SessionFactory.

property.name: hibernateDialect
property.documentation: SQL dialect of the database being used.

property.name: hibernateDefaultSchema
property.documentation: Qualify unqualified tablenames with the given schema/tablespace in generated SQL.

property.name: hibernateMaxFetchDepth
property.documentation: Sets a maximum "depth" for the outer join fetch tree. eg. recommended values between 0 and 3

property.name: hibernateJdbcFetchSize
property.documentation: A non-zero value determines the JDBC fetch size.

property.name: hibernateJdbcBatchSize
property.documentation: A nonzero value enables use of JDBC2 batch updates by Hibernate. ex: recommended values between 5 and 30

property.name: hibernateJdbcUseScrollableResultSet
property.documentation: Whether or not to enable use of JDBC2 scrollable resultsets by Hibernate. This property is only necessary when using user supplied connections. Hibernate uses connection metadata otherwise.

property.name: hibernateJdbcUseStreamsForBinary
property.documentation: Whether or not to use streams when writing / reading binary or serializable types to/from JDBC

property.name: hibernateHbm2DDLAuto
property.documentation:
Automatically export schema DDL to the database when the SessionFactory is created. With create-drop, the database schema will be dropped when the SessionFactory is closed explicitely. Permitted values are:
update
create
create-drop

property.name: hibernateQuerySubstitutions
property.documentation: Allows you to define new Hibernate query tokens. For example: giving this a value of true=1, false=0 would cause the tokens true and false to be translated to integer literals in the generated SQL.

property.name: hibernateUseQueryCache
property.documentation:
The default query cache usage. Can be overwritten using @andromda.hibernate.query.useCache. Possible values are:
true
false

property.name: hibernateCacheProvider
property.documentation: Defines the Hibernate cache provider implementation class.

property.name: hibernateQueryCacheFactory
property.documentation: Defines Hibernate Query Cache Factory implementation class

propertyGroup.name: Acegi Security
propertyGroup.documentation: Configures the declaritive role based security without EJB, which uses the Acegi Security System for Spring.

property.name: acegiServiceSecurity
property.documentation: Whether or not acegi security framework should be used for role based recurity handling for spring services.

property.name: acegiServiceSecurityInterceptor
property.documentation: The name of the class to use for the acegi security interception.

property.name: acegiServiceAccessDecisionManager
property.documentation: The name of the class to use for the acegi security access decision manager.

property.name: acegiServiceDecisionVoter
property.documentation: The name of the class to use for the acegi security access decision voter.

property.name: acegiAuthenticationManager
property.documentation: The bean name of the acegi authentication manager (defined in a seperate applicationContext outside of the generated one).

property.name: acegiRunAsManager
property.documentation: The bean name of the acegi run as manager (defined in a seperate applicationContext outside of the generated one).
